Body:
Can anyone please explain the code below to me?

I am making a project of voice controlled home appliances using nodemcu, Google Assistant and blynk app. I'd like to know what's inside the blynk.run as well as blynk.begin so that I can understand this code much better. 

#define BLYNK_PRINT Serial		#include <ESP8266WiFi.h>	#include <BlynkSimpleEsp8266.h>		// You should get Auth Token in the Blynk App.	// Go to the Project Settings (nut icon).	char auth[] = YourAuthToken";		// Your WiFi credentials.	// Set password to "" for open networks.	char ssid[] = "YourNetworkName";	char pass[] = "YourPassword";		void setup()	{	  // Debug console	  Serial.begin(9600);		  Blynk.begin(auth

How is this even possible? You can't write code not knowing what it does, if that were possible how would you know how to write the code in the first place? That's like trying to start a fire without knowing you need heat.
euh @MBer:  ``#error This code is not intended to run on the ESP8266 platform! Please check your Tools->Board setting.``. Also the code is not really informative because it only runs a library.
